notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna after folios 16, 33, 49, 78, 81, 82, 85, 87, 113 ,116. Several leaves more or less damaged.

An entry with the date 5525 (1765) as the time when the manuscript to which this page belonged originally was finished, folio 124r. Yedidyah Shelomoh Nasi ben Amtsiyahu Yosef Nasi: inscribed in an owner's entry, folio 17r. Shelomoh ben Eliyahu Ḥazan: inscribed, folio 122v.A note on the number of persons to be called up at the reading of the Torah, folio 17v.An English description of the manuscript in pencil, in a modern hand: folio [iii verso].
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An introduction to Karaite ritual according to the use of Damascus, containing a series of liturgical directions, followed by the tracts on the accents, Hebrew grammar etc.

msItem.title: Series of biblical verses for Megilat Purim
A series of piyuṭim for Sabbath-days and festivals

collation.p: Indeterminable (the manuscript is fragmentary; originally quires consisted of mostly 4 and 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic numerals on the first page).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script, partly punctuated, of the late 17th century. Daniel ben Mosheh ha-Melamed ben Yesh῾ayah Firuz: inscribed, folio 1r & 81r.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Karaite Ritual. Heb. & Arab. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2536.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed (folio [128v]).
